title: Lasya
detailsOfAchievement: Lasya is a 16-year old trust dedicated solely towards the preservation, propagation and promotion of Indian Classical Dance and the Indian Theatre arts. Lasya runs a one-of-its-kind Kathak Diploma, affiliated to the department of Continuing and Adult Education and Extension Work of the S.N.D.T. Womenâ€™s University. The module contains a 3-year old Diploma and a 2-year Advanced Diploma in Dance (Kathak). Secondly, Lasya also runs many certificate courses (affiliated to the Akhil Bharatiya Gandharva Mahavidyalaya Mandal) and Scholarship programs (affiliated to the N.C.E.R.T.). Lasya regularly conducts seminars, symposiums, theatre workshops and interactive discussions for its students and all other dance students and enthusiasts all over the metropolis. We frequently organize interactive lecture-demonstrations and workshops by many guest dignitaries from the Classical Fine Art field viz. authors, poets, cultural historians, scholars, dance â€˜Guru-sâ€™ etc. who share their experiences and knowledge with the students. Lasya annually conducts three major dance and music festivals â€“ YATRA â€“ This is the national festival of choreography, organized by Lasya; that celebrates International Dance Day[29th April]- as declared by the U.N.E.S.C.O. Here the Guru-s, stalwarts and reputed choreographers of the Indian Classical Dance field; are invited by Lasya from all corners of the nation; to present their choicest and exquisite choreographic works to the Mumbai audiences. Rajashree Shirke has since 2003 been organizing the Yatra festival. Yatra, which means â€˜journeyâ€™ features established and upcoming talent from different corners of India and different dance styles on a common platform. The intension is to feature Group Choreography which allows the classical dance movement to flourish as well as bring together dancers from all over the country in a spirit of friendship and togetherness. MADHURANG â€“ This is another festival of performing arts in remembrance of our dear beloved Late Guru Madhurita Sarang. Lasya organizes this Indian Classical Music & Dance Festival on the eve of her death anniversary. Since the year 2005, Lasya has been organizing a wide range of performances of dancers, instrumentalists and vocalists who have performed at this festival. This has, over the years, become an important dais for many up-coming artists and new talent in the city. SOPAAN MAHOTSAV- A festival of Theatre, Music and Theatre-Dance; begun since 2016. This festival is for creating, showcasing and acknowledging new and experimental theatrical endeavours by Lasya and other theatre-bodies of Mumbai and India in general. That way, the students of Dance, Theatre and Music can have a holistic inter-relative perspective of Theatre and Music and dance and how these disciples weave together originally to bring back the ancient concept of â€˜total theatreâ€™. Lasya also has a strong functional Dance Repertory of its own trained-professional dancers who regularly perform under the Lasya banner â€“ and are active in all of Lasyaâ€™s cultural endeavours. Lasya also has a social awareness wing called â€“ â€˜Lasya Sankalpâ€™ that creates programs, workshops and teaches Indian Classical Dance, Folk Dance and Theatre to the under-privileged girls from the Municipal Schools of Suburban Mumbai; which includes regular training sessions of dance, theatre and childrenâ€™s theatre plays.

Late Ashatai Vishnupant Deshmukh Charitable Trust and its project Central India Cancer Foundation, Nagpur, working for betterment of society in this region. The trust conduct cancer diagnosis camps, cancer surgery camps, cancer awareness lectures and slides shows on cancer and mass education on cancer.
